alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 05 at 8:43PM PST until January 06 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Much of Lake County from Highways 31 and 395 eastward. This includes highway 31 from Valley Falls to Silver Lake, highway 395 from Valley Falls northward into central Oregon, and highway 140 east of Lakeview. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 4 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Travel will be difficult for high profile vehicles * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...1 to 2 inches of snow is also expected during this period of advisory level winds. Blowing snow will lead to periods of reduced visibility and could make driving conditions even more challenging in this area. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
